p: Ambrosia artemisiifolia and A. trifida invaded the Yili Valley starting in 2010. Since 2014, the areas occupied by these two species have increased rapidly, although A. artemisiifolia is distributed over a larger area than A. trifida. By 2017, these two species had occupied 1,322 and 311 km 2, respectively; thus, the former occupied 4.25 times the area inhabited by A. trifida (Figure 1).
